likes.disliked: — I liked everything about the accommodation - there isn't anything not to like. If I had to pick something, I'd say there is no pool or jacuzzi, but that isn't high on my list of things anyway.

reviews.text: In Mexico this means being out and about from midnight to four or five am. Not my cup of tea!. Our very gracious hosts personally escorted Philip for the entire evening! More than great service!
reviews.title: I Love LaPerla!

reviews.text: La Perla is a beautifully restored 19th century Mexican colonial bed and breakfast in the heart of historic Guadalajara. It is a small bed and breakfast, with three rooms - just perfect as you will quickly become friends with the other guests. Chris, Lars and the whole staff are very friendly and eager to make your stay a memory not to be forgotten. We have been 4 times and each visit has been better than the one before. It is within easy walking distance to the historic district and much of the night life that this very safe city has to offer. If you are looking for a convenient, quiet place to stay in an urban setting, La Perla is for you! I highly recommend it - you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Great place, great Guys! Beautiful Hospitality!!!

reviews.text: LaPerla is a special house, with high ceilings and large windows, a grand staircase, and a lovely roof top terrace. The location- colonia Americana- is a 5-10 min walk from downtown and provides a bit more serenity than most downtown inns and hotels that I have stayed at, especially in major cities. Laperla and her owners came recommended to me from a friend and I have returned 3 or 4 times.

likes.liked: — Accommodations, location, nice neighbourhood, friendly hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were looking for reasonably priced, but nice, accommodation in the main University of Guadalajara area, somewhere between Calz. Federalismo and Minerva, i.e., a place within walking distance of Teatro Degollado and downtown, but in a quiet residential neighbourhood away from downtown. We also wanted to be able to walk to some of our favourite restaurants, like Sacromonte, as well as to explore some of the shops that sell Espresso Machines. Our goals were all met--exceeded-- at La Perla.
reviews.title: Best B&B!!!!
wonderful time at LaPerla
reviews.text: The accommodations are beautiful (see our pictures) and very comfortable. We stayed in La Cine, the smallest of the existing rooms, but it felt very large and spacious because of the high ceilings and the little library right outside the door of our room, making La Cine seem as if it is a suite. The private balcony was lovely to sit out on enjoying a drink. If one wants more space, you simply go up a flight of stairs to their magnificent rooftop patio (more on that below), where they have loungers and an Honor Bar (beer and wine). Our bed, a Queen, and pillows were very comfortable. Since the plumbing and wiring are completely new, there was great water pressure and lots of hot water too. Umbrellas and an electric blanket in the armoire as well as a clock radio with CD player give one the feeling of being very welcome. There is also complimentary HiSpeed Internet Access in each room, as well as Wireless throughout the house. Guests are also welcome to use the house computer in the bar area (complimentary of course).

As other reviewers have pointed out, staying at La Perla is like staying with friends. Unlimited bottled water is complimentary and readily available at any time. Guests are shown the cupboard where supplies (bottled water, towels, soap and shampoo, Kleenex, etc.) are kept and welcomed to help themselves as needed. One of the owners, Lars, always makes a fresh pot of coffee by app. 7:00 am and guests are often offered nightcaps and before dinner wine all served in beautiful crystal glassware. The continental breakfast is also tasty, made with fresh ingredients, all served elegantly—yet informally--in the dining room. If your schedule permits, the hosts eat breakfast with you, providing an opportunity to answer questions, or just chat. One of the owners, Cris, has family in Guadalajara, is totally fluent in Spanish, and has an intimate knowledge of Mexican life. Both hosts are a mine of valuable information.
reviews.title: Truly Boutique Bed and Breakfast
Fabulous time at La Perla
reviews.text: One of my favourite parts of La Perla was the beautiful rooftop deck. Always evolving, it already has a full-size washer and dryer (front loading Maytag Neptune series) which guests are welcome to use. There is also a full kitchen which guests can use (when not in use for events) especially for refrigerating leftovers, and also an Honor Bar (beer is 10 pesos and wine is 100 pesos). Planned for the future are a hot tub and a dipping pool.

description: As our guest, you will feel like one of the Mexican movie stars connected to LA PERLA’s past: Gloria Marin, Jorge Negrete, Maria Felix… The Moorish mansion embodies the glamour of the famous old casas of Guadalajara, Jalisco.With a perfect location in the historical center, LA PERLA continues to be the place to meet interesting people and to discover what this exciting city offers. Whether visiting our city for business, vacation or study abroad, you can count on LA PERLA Boutique Bed and Breakfast to make your visit more exciting than any other hotel, inn, B&B, or guesthouse. From the time we pick you up at the International Airport, the time we spend with you will make your experience discovering Guadalajara better than just memorable. We will help you plan your free time which can include:Travel to nearby towns including Tequila, Ajijic and Lake Chapala, Colima and Puerto Vallarta as well as longer trips such as to Mexico City, the Yucatan, Oaxaca and San Miguel de Allende in the State of Guanajuato.Visits to the restaurants or night clubs for Latin music and dancing. We are also happy to help you obtain tickets to Mexican soccer league games (called futbol here); concert, symphony and dance performances; bull fights (called corrida de toros), Guadalajara’s mariachi and foreign film festivals as well as other cultural events.
